Overall%20Experience.Review: The dorm life is the heart of campus and is like everything good about Greek life without the bad. Best combination of academics, athletics, and faith life of any school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I’m from Seattle and a friend of mine goes here and he’s very happy to be here he’s friends with his roommate who’s a part of the football team. And overall the school is very chill.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have loved every second at the University of Notre Dame. There is a sense of community and collaboration I have never seen at other Universities. The resources, opportunities, and access to professors is unmatched and the alumni network is great!!!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: ND is a really unique community, and I think my favorite thing about it was that so many of the students there feel motivated to make a positive contribution through their careers, not just in it for the money. Campus is beautiful and super safe, and there are just a zillion ways to have fun as a student there. As a downside, definitely less diversity than some other schools, but there are a lot of ways to find your people, no matter who you are. Finding your version of ND is important: not everyone loves football, and there's a strong current that will want to sweep you up in that, but going to games is NOT the only thing to do on Saturdays. I went to like 3 games a year, and that was enough for me. Staying grounded, finding your friends, and making sure you take advantage of the academic resources available there would be my tips for success. Good luck!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Arriving on campus is handled aptly. A community is formed within the first few weeks of arrival. The immersion and involvement of the upperclassmen in the freshman's lives make the transition go smoother than otherwise. The amount of brotherhood formed in a mens dorm is unparralleled. If you want community and genuine connection with people in the first few weeks go to Notre Dame. One consideration is that the campus is slightly lacking in the diversity field, but that has never felt cumbersome at all. If you look, god will provide. Lastly, racism has not been an issue for me here and everyone is so welcoming no matter what culture you represent.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience at University of Notre Dame was horrible. Everyone bullied me and the professors were sooooooooooooo mean. Do not go to that school if you value you mental and physical health.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Works Here

Overall%20Experience.Review: Notre Dame lives up to its reputation as a faith-based school with rigorous academics. In my first couple semesters, I have learned to focus on my own success and improvement instead of comparing myself to my peers. This was discussed well in our First-Year Moreau course. As a POC who is non-denominational Christian at a predominately White and Catholic institution, I deeply appreciate the separate clubs for those of us out of the majority to gather. That being said, there is definitely a lack of understanding from the majority of students as these other groups and cultures aren't promoted or integrated as much into every day activities. Leaving us to still feel as if we're on a separate island. I believe that bringing different groups together would help us understand one another more, leading to a greater sense of belonging.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Notre Dame is the ultimate package! Dorm life is truly one of the best contributors to the community, and academics are truly challenging and rewarding. The opportunities offered by the university and the alumni network are endless.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Solid 6.5-7/10. Small town and not very diverse so can easily reinforce negative stereotypes  that said, if you can find your people, you will be friends for life. I would highly recommend making the most of it because the time will fly by before you know it
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am a highschool student currently in an engineering camp called IEP. The experience has been amazing and truly special. The professor and students (counselors 9f the camp) have been incredibly and extremely nice and welcoming. The programs it’s self is really help and eye opening in helping you decide which area on engineering you would like the most and see yourself in. Ramzi Bualuan the coordinator of the camp is just amazing and extremely nice.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: I had a great time at the University of Notre Dame. I was thoroughly challenged academically throughout my time there.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The say the people make the place, and that could not be more true at Notre Dame. I learned so much from my professors and grew not just as a student but as a person as well. My classmates constantly inspired me, and I am so grateful to graduate with lifelong friends who are not only incredibly smart but also so kind and caring.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Notre Dame fosters a community like no other. The people there care and support you no matter if they are a student, professor, or staff.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: There are opportunites for everyone to strive and meet people that are similar to them. Students are also put to a high academic standard and you should see the library during finals week.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: My time here at Notre Dame has been a major culture shock, both with the people here and the academics. Compared to other schools the academics are more rigorous but it comes at the cost of less diversity.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Overall loved my time at Notre Dame. The quality of the academics and research opportunities is great. Socially there's also a lot of fun things to do on campus and around South Bend. Downsides for me was that there's not a ton of diversity and the weather can be rough in the winter, but that's really it!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I wish there were more financial aid resources and scholarships you could apply for though people are very nice here.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: There's no place like Notre Dame.  Every day was something new, and while I did fall into a busy routine, I could always fall asleep with a dozen new stories and connections.  The community is unparalleled, with dorm life acting as the foundation for most of my friendships, and classroom bonding supplementing the rest.  The engineering department especially is great and offers so many resources and opportunities for students to excel.  The many technical clubs as well as others are also spectacular and have included many of my best experiences here.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The greatest decision of of my life.  I can't imagine a better school. I loved everything about my experience.  Love thee Notre Dame.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Notre Dame has a community of students who are driven both spiritually and academically to be their best selves. Over my time at UND, all students are united towards a common goal of being educated in both their hearts and minds to serve others in the world. For example, there are two students who really impacted my life named Caroline and Liam who changed my perspective on the idea of vocation and living out your life in service of God through your life. Vocation is about using your gifts to change the world and the University of Notre Dame helps cultivate students to be young men and women who do just that.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Overall campus community is great. Everyone is very supportive and kind rather than being competitive with each other.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Steeped in tradition, and a rare example of an institution not gripped in far left wing brain rot that has diminished other colleges. No better school for football and academics. The only comparable schools for academic and athletic excellence without compromise is Duke in Basketball, Vandy in Baseball, and BC in hockey.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The academics are challenging, but the friendships formed and the overall experience is extrememly rewarding, life-changing and will remain with me always. Very grateful for my 4 years at ND!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: So good. Sports amazing. Fun. Amazing People. You should go her. Catholic but do not have to be catholic.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Attending Notre Dame is the best choice I ever made. From the dorm that becomes your family, to the professors who help you find yourself and excel, to the classmates of all backgrounds who become your best friends, and a beautiful campus to live on, the University of Notre Dame is a force for good that is an honor to be a part of.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Notre Dame is a welcoming  community, full of people who are interested in your well-being, and growth as a student. It is a rigorous school but there are enough resources to help you reach your goal. People are dedicated and integrated into the community through sports, clubs, and more.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Notre Dame has vastly grown as a community. As a low income and first generation college student, I can say that I have received support and assistance with expenses such as laptops/ipad, winter clothes, business clothes and more. Defiantly strong on traditions and community. Overall, I have been loving my time at Notre Dame, even though academics can be rigorous.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The community here is just unmatched. Everyone is so welcoming and everywhere you look, there is someone to help you out. The professors truly care for their students and there are so many amazing opportunities here. They always have some activity to get people more involved and I love how many amazing things Notre Dame brings to its students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have spent only my freshman fall semester at Notre Dame and am already in love with the school. One unique aspect of Notre Dame is the dorm life, which I cannot speak more highly of. The community provided by this social structure is genuine, inclusive, supportive, and exciting. I also feel that as a student, I am cared for by everyone at the university and have a vast number of opportunities to develop academically, professionally, and spiritually.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The Catholic aspect of Notre Dame really grounds the university. The professors try to teach the classes with the overall goal of the students becoming "forces for good in the world." However, the financial aid aspect of Notre Dame does not follow the school's Catholic nature. While they say they meet their "designated needs" of students, that is all rather subjective. With the large endowment, financial aid is something Notre Dame needs to improve upon.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have loved my experience at Notre Dame so far. From the football games to being member of the all men's choir there, my Notre Dame experience has enriched my life thus far. The classes are challenging, but they possess great amount of rigor that will prepare me for my graduate education. I love my school and I would not want to be anywhere else.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The Notre Dame experience is not just 4 years of college, but 4 years of community. Notre Dame is where you solidify the kind of person you want to be in this world and where you meet the indispensable people who will guide and support you, like family, for the rest of your life.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I went to visit the campus/school for football. I was able to meet the coaches, watch the game, and learn a lot about the campus. it was a great experience overall. and I would not want to change anything.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Very good school. Very different from other tops 20 schools based on culture. Very much would recommend.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Amazing community and campus views. Middle sized school that makes you find close friends while also always having new people to meet. Great opportunities and alumni network.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a transfer student, I was welcomed with open arms. The staff and faculty is very helpful as well as the students. I was really surprised by how friendly and nice the students on campus were. Notre Dame also shows their commitments to the students. They help with career paths, connecting you to employers, and motivating students in their field of study. You can tell the professors love being at Notre Dame. So far, it has been a blessing experience to get to attend classes on this campus. Even though there are quite a lot of students, professors and staff go out of their way to make time for students individually. I went into Japanese class as a first time learner. The language professors are especially dedicated and encouraging. I loved it to the point of making it a minor and planning to study abroad in Japan of summer 2024. Along with the outstanding academics, there are hundreds of clubs to join on campus, so no one is left out. Notre Dame is a place of opportunity and growth.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Notre Dame is a very welcoming school and has very inclusive programs. Although the school is a catholic school, they do not push anyone to be a part of the religion. Very honest and welcoming community.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Greatest decision of my life. They have prepared me to do anything I want after graduation, and what I want to do is work in investment banking.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: It was a really great experience. I'm really glad that there was a church there, especially for me to practice my faith. I'm not actually a student, yet at least, but I've been to the campus multiple and was very impressed with the facilities and the students there.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is a great place to go to college!  There are so many things to do and it is a prestigious institution.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Best decision I ever made. Extraordinary undergraduate engagement through inspired teaching and mentoring. Lifelong friendships with faculty and peers. A commitment to reasoned discourse. Study abroad encouraged and facilitated even if pre med. Gorgeous campus. Inclusive residential life. Brilliant yet helpful classmates from every state and over 100 countries. I still regularly talk to my roommates 34 years later. Unparalleled sports with far reaching esprit de corps. As an undergraduate English Philosophy Pre Med Major whose now a Pediatric Psychiatrist, I would love to do it all again. When I occasionally go back to campus I love perusing the bookstore stacks to see what kids are reading these days in the disciplines. I remain grateful they have not abandoned their mission to form young people to be a force for good in the world. When I talk to current students, they give me hope.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Notre Dame has a beautiful campus and wonderful people there to guide new and upcoming students. I loved the greenery all around and the old classical style buildings. While I wish it was in a safer part of Indiana, I still love the college with all my heart and cannot wait for the endless opportunities that await me within their walls.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The campus is so beautiful and you will immediately feel like you are home as soon as you step out of your car. It has such a welcoming environment and all the people are so nice.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Overall, I was very happy with my first year at Notre Dame. While the classes were challenging and the weather isn't always the best, the people made the place. The people at Notre Dame are truly amazing. Every person I met at Notre Dame the past year, whether it was a teacher or fellow student has a special kindness to them. Everyone I met would be willing to drop what they were doing at any moment to help you if you needed the help. Consequently, at Notre Dame I felt safe and at home. I knew that the people there had my back and will help me achieve the goals I have set for myself. At Notre Dame I am not only set up to succeed career wise, but more importantly I have been impacted and set up for being a genuinely good person who is concerned about helping benefit society as a whole.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Notre Dame's career center is one of many excellent resources for its students. Moreover, alumni provide extensive support to the Notre Dame family, especially in helping students find the right careers paths. 

If there is one thing Notre Dame could improve on, it would be to build its non-business departments stronger.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Amazing really liked the campus and the professors, did not love the online software they used called moodle.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: While Notre Dame has a long way to go in terms of inclusion- specifically with the LGBTQ+ community- I am very grateful for the people and the experiences I have had so far. This school has a way of bringing people together whether through random dorm/roommate assignments as first years or through various events on campus. Resources are also highly accessible with mental health services offered for free to ALL students regardless of insurance plans, as well as a specific fund for low-income students that covers necessities such as winter clothes and laptop/laptop repairs. During my time here, I have been able to find support everywhere, especially my dorm and friends groups and several scholars programs. My only complaint is that Notre Dame is located in South Bend, Indiana where it has long and very cold winters with a permacloud that never goes away. Being from Arizona however, I have learned to adjust to the weather.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I liked the culture and the amazing opportunities the school offers. There are many opportunities to partake in research and connect with alum. The dorm culture allows for friends to be made easily. I would like for the entitled attitude of some students to change.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: My overall experience in the university has been an eye-opening event for me. I have been exposed to pharmacology and clinical research objectives at an earlier period in my university experience. I am pleased with the new exploration of CRISPR in relation to Daphnia and how editing of a single Nucleotide can cause mutation and neuronal damage. I would like to see more engagement between peers of all ages.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Notre Dame is a fantastic school. Aside from great classes and amazing faculty, the community at Notre Dame is what makes it so special. Everyone can feel at home at Notre Dame.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: great friends, gorgeous campus, and football is a ton of fun! Could have had more career support as a science student, and the dorm restrictions were not my favorite because they were not equal for the male vs female dorms. I think there should be some apartment-style dorms on campus!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Notre Dame is one of the most amazing places to be. The school is so family oriented and super supportive of your academic and career achievements. The people who you are surrounded with are also very supportive of you. Although it is a competitive school, everyone around you is willing to help you so that everyone can become the best versions of their academic and professional selves.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Notre Dame has been one of the highlights of my life! The balance between course work and the social environment is great! The traditions make the memories even more meaningful! The connections you make are incredible.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: If you're not Christian and white, you probably should go somewhere else. Town is dead.  Academics are mediocre.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: The peculiarity of Notre Dame I really enjoy how cozy it feels. It's a stunning campus that is contained because it isn't in a city and no traffic pass through it. The sense of security and comfort it offers is something I really appreciate. It stinks because of the anal rules prohibiting girls and guys from visiting each other late at night. There are many regulations, but they really don't stop anyone from doing anything; they merely require that they do it quietly or in secret. The community at Notre Dame is its best feature. Upon entering the campus, you immediately feel at home. Anywhere you go, if you run into Notre Dame alumni, they'll buy you dinner, help you get a job, or even just invite you over to watch the ND football game. I adore Notre Dame's spirituality. I also appreciate how concerned the school is with the children' futures. Because it is a very safe campus with students who watch out for one another, it is very beneficial for undergraduates.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am an incoming freshman from Ukraine, and from what I heard and saw visiting campus, it's a really good place to be.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Overpriced and overrated. Great place if you're white, Christian, and male. Academics are weak. Indiana is a MAGA wasteland. Good luck. I transferred out as quick as I could.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved Notre Dame. There were a lot of opportunities here that I could not find at other colleges. Highly recommend.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review:
University of Notre Dame is a very rewarding school, but you have to spend your time wisely. Getting to know professors and peers beyond the three hours a week you spend in their classroom is very important. College is what you make of it no matter where you go, and Notre Dame is no different. 
The academics are definitely nothing to laugh at, almost no class I've taken here has been curved, but some do offer extra credit in forms of going to research talks, doing research, etc. 
Dorm life is great. You get to choose little/much you're involved, and will almost guaranteed find some of your best friends if you put yourself out there a little.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I could not have imagined myself at a better school. Felt like home and I was totally drinking the green Kool-Aid by the end (I was an RA my senior year and it was the best decision I ever made).
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The ND experience can’t be put into words. If you’re a prospective student, trust the feeling in your gut telling you to come.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Notre dame was an amazing school the students were very kind and the school was just so good I hope that you enjoy it to
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Challenging academics, excellent community, vast opportunities for engagement and extracurriculars, fun games and sports, diverse student body, plus you can live out your faith.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the community and all the motivated, kind people here. The professors are committed to their students' learning, and the students take on a collaborative approach to work. There are so many clubs for any interest one may have. It is very easy to get involved with undergraduate research if that interests you. They cater a lot to their undergraduate population and make you feel seen as a whole person who they care for.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
My favorite thing about Notre Dame is it truly feels like a family. The school values community building, and there are SO many resources for students to build the relationships and careers they want. 

Its downside is that ND is not very diverse. Although the university is taking steps to build diversity on campus, there are definitely minorities on campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the beautiful campus of Notre Dame. The community in the dorms is so fun and welcoming, though it is not the most diverse campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Notre Dame is such a beautiful school on the outside, but also its traditions and faith are beautiful as well.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Notre Dame is truly an amazing place. The unique housing/dorm system, well-rounded & motivated professors, active student body (including their party scene), renown sports events and beautiful campus creates a surreal college experience. Highly recommend at least visiting to any prospective college student
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: My step mom went there and enjoyed it very much. She expresses that the college provided her with everything that she needed including study abroad.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: The university is a very welcoming place, where the faculty and administration truly want to support their students and give them opportunities to succeed in their chosen field. All of the students are quite focused on their goals and support each other in their separate journeys. Some diversity may be lacking, but strong communities are built around any and all minorities.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved my experience at Notre Dame, but it is an experience that you get out of what you put in. This is true of all schools, but Notre Dame has a niche for every student. It truly is just a matter of finding your spot. Unlike many other universities, there is an option for wholesome fun that is generally partaken in by the majority of students instead of smaller groups or cliques.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great community supported by dorm life and football season. Focused on developing you as a student and as a person. Ensures you are well rounded as a person entering the work-force.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I particularly enjoyed how Notre Dame made me feel like I was prepared for my future, I don't think any other school could have provided me such a vast alumni network in my field, and connected me with fellow students who shared my desire to learn, but also serve those around me .
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I attended their Leadership Seminars over the summer and I loved everything about it. Hope it becomes more diverse over time but as of right now, it is amazing.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: This University lacks diversity a lot! This is a University where 60 - 80% people are coming from White Wealthy family. Some classes are pretty generic. And food is terrible. Location is not that good at all.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Perfect size for me, beautiful campus, very active student community, great alumni network, lots of school spirit
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Notre Dame is a school like no other. Students are dedicated and driven to learn and better themselves. It is an environment that promotes learning while also valuing the good aspects in our lives.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Overall, I'm happy with my Notre Dame experience thus far. With so many options for majors and minors, there is plenty of room for academic exploration and personalization. My professors have been phenomenal. On the whole, ND professors are accessible, caring, and intelligent. These traits are consistent throughout the ND community. I came to ND knowing nobody. It was easy to meet people through my dorm, classes, and clubs. The students are also extremely collaborative and willing to work together on assignments and test prep. This sense of community also extends to the alumni network. From the moment I got into ND, I've been in contact with my local alumni club. 

While there are cons to ND, such as its location, Catholic background (for some), and high cost, even as a progressive, mid-income, non-Catholic, I have found my people. I also received a financial aid package that made ND affordable for my family. I find that the pros of ND far outweigh any of the cons.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Notre Dame University is one of the finest universities. The curriculum is well studied and updated. Even though we had to take some courses online due to the pandemic  the University managed to keep the high standards of education.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Notre Dame provides a rigorous academic environment that allows one to reach new heights in their educational journey. Not only this, but you will create long-lasting friendships. You will be challenged, but you will have so much fun along the way.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: To start, Notre Dame is a great school. In most circumstances, the university cares about the wellbeing and success of its students. The faculty are great being both knowledgeable in their field and respecting their students. Notre Dame is a tough school to get into and those academic standards continue to be expected once a student is admitted. For the most part, the culture of Notre Dame is good; great sporting events, impressive school spirit, longstanding traditions. But this culture lacks diversity and inclusion and is steeped in arrogance. Students mostly come from wealthy families so the investment of the high tuition costs is not too terrible for them and this spoiled attitude is definitely noticeable. Additionally, for what it costs to attend the university, there is little value outside of having 'Notre Dame' on a resume. All in all, is Notre Dame necessarily worth the hype? No, but it is a great school nonetheless.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: - like campus culture (values based, very safe and welcoming environment, people are very trusting of one another)
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: An excellent school, extremely challenging, but life changing. I wouldn't go somewhere else, but I would have chosen to bite off less academically so I could succeed better in the areas I chose.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is a wonderful institution because of the holistic offerings. The most important aspect is that at this place the community and academics challenge you integrally: spirit, body, and mind. Not being Catholic, I recommend encountering this experience of self-discovery beside amazing diverse individuals. I never thought that I could experience this level of happiness and gratitude.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: School is amazing and I had a very good first year. Classes are very academically challenging but there are many university required classes that are easier.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is a very challenging academic atmosphere. Socially, there is a mix of pros and cons to the huge focus on creating community in the on-campus dorms. Despite randomly being placed onto a dorm, a big part of on-campus identity and social life is which dorm you live in. You make friends in your dorm and tons of social events and support are offered through them. I think for some people though it might feel forced or not really their speed. There are more rules in dorms than living in an apartment off campus as well.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Notre Dame is an excellent community. The professors genuinely care about their students, the dorm communities are fantastic, and there is always something to do. The campus is also beautiful.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Notre Dame has a great school spirit and campus life. In addition to a top-tier, rigorous education you can also enjoy your time at college. Everyone is super collaborative, friendly, and extremely accepting regardless of differences. The faculty is super acceptable and want to speak to you or help you with coursework when needed. People have close-knit friendships with their dorms and all partake in signature traditions. Plus the campus is awesome!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Notre Dame has a weird culture...I would definitely visit if you can and feel out if it is right for you. Try to see it with clear eyes. The ND network is strong, but the pressure to be a certain kind of person while a student is strong too. There is a lack of diversity - racial, socioeconomic, and diversity of backgrounds - which means that students who do not fit within those groups have to work harder to find their way.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The community here is like no other that I have experienced, everyone here is very kind and helpful. There are countless options for anyone can do over the weekend whether that is sports, clubs, or activities. The classes tend to overlap with on another as they're centers around the same core principals. The religious life on campus is also very nice as you are able express your religious values no matter your religion.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Dream university, visited this year and the campus was really nice. Everyone was friendly and had great things to say about the university.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Go Irish Go Irish Go Irish Go Irish Go Irish Go Irish Go Irish Go Irish Go Irish Go Irish Go Irish Go Irish Go Irish Go Irish Go Irish Go Irish Go Irish Go Irish Go Irish Go Irish Go Irish Go Irish Go Irish Go IrishGo Irish Go Irish Go Irish Go Irish Go Irish Go Irish Go Irish Go Irish
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The student body is energetic, hardworking, and religious. The professors truly care about the students’ well-being, and there are plenty of resources available to get help and explore areas you are interested in.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I’m very grateful for having had the opportunity to study at ND and if I were to go back and do the whole college selection process again, I’m confident I would choose Notre Dame. Now I know there’s plenty of people that believe ND students/alumni have an over-inflated opinion on our school, but I can confidently say that there isn’t really an aspect of the school that I would change. The holistic and competitive academics; a year-round stunning campus; top-notch athletics; a social environment that truly lives up to the “work hard, play hard” moniker; a long list of excellent career opportunities and connections (alumni network is crucial); steeped in incredible traditions (alma mater is iconic every time) and virtuous goals; and, most importantly, unbelievable people who are intelligent and caring individuals that make me excited at the prospect of forging more bonds with them. 

Come to Notre Dame, you won’t regret it and go Irish.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Absolutely incredible. I love the campus, the food, the people, the catholic aspect of the school. There is something for everyone and I am confident that I will find my crowd there.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Notre Dame offers every opportunity for students to succeed both academically and personally. The community is truly a community. One that is filled with never ending support. Notre Dame’s mission is felt on campus. Great academics. Great community. Great fun.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I visited my friend's brother at the University of Notre Dame and it was an amazing experience. All the students are friendly, great sports, and the campus is beautiful. There is always somethign to be doing; between dorm parties, restauraunts, or intramurial sports, you will not be bored while at this university. The extensive alumni network after you graduate will give you great job security as well. Finally, this school has amazing spirit. People show up for a lot of the games, and people wear Notre Dame gear all the time!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Notre Dame is a great school and a good return on your investment if you major in STEM or business.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I had a great experience at Notre Dame - the campus is so pretty and the school spirit is unparalleled, especially during football seasons. South Bend isn't the best town out there but the campus and student life make up for the location.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The university needs more housing to accommodate transfer students. It would be nice if the core requirements list was updated to allow more freedom for students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Incredible school with endless opportunities and resources. If nothing else, Notre Dame attracts not only the smartest people in the country, but also some of the most hard-working, kind, humble, and inspirational. The academics are difficult but the professors are some of the best in the nation and genuinely care about their students Student life is very involved and has a place for everyone. Student body draws from a fairly diverse array of viewpoints and political beliefs. If nothing else, access to the Notre Dame alumni network makes it worth the high tuition and hard work to get into Notre Dame and graduate from there.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The campus is absolutely breathtaking and gorgeous with beautiful mature trees and wonderful landscaping.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: My daughter just got accepted here. Every detail of the process of application speaks highly of the strong values of the University and the fact that they offered a generous grant for an international student that really fits the spirit of ND, speaks highly about their desire to have a diverse student body
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Notre Dame is a great place for students looking for a challenging academic environment but also a social one. It often gives the feel of a prestigious, academic driven school during the week and a big-10 school on the weekends. The football games are a blast. The school is a perfect size and so easily walkable. The course offerings can be frustrating though and it is very hard to change majors after the first year. There is also a huge corporate push for students to pursue.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Professors were fantastic, summer opportunities were very formative, and study abroad programs were both financially accesible and amazing. While Catholicism and football might seem to be the main draws to the school, neither of those were central to my experience and I still loved it.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like that Notre Dame emphasizes a strong community component within its dorm system, alumni network, and it’s teachings. However, I think it has a long way to go to make it an all inclusive community concerning gender, race, and sexuality.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I took a campus visit in September 2021, and the admissions department staff and student tour guides were very friendly, informational, and personable.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Don’t come here if you want to party. Seriously. It’s got a beautiful campus, good teachers, great class sizes and prestige but such a terrible social scene.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Honestly, this place is stifling. If you wanna survive it you could either be rich, white and catholic or come with a good group of friends
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Notre Dame was an incredible experience - academically, socially, and spiritually. Would recommend for both undergrad and grad.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great professors and strong academics, also good support for online courses. Good safety protocol for pandemic
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: There is something exceedingly special about Notre Dame. Whether it is the place or the people, an aura of excellence and tradition exudes from its grounds. The idea of a university founded on principle and the concept of people-driven academics drives me to say that Notre Dame is one of the best there is. The caliber of its student body is exceptional and its dedication to the undergraduate experience is phenomenal. Even if you aren't Catholic or even religious, if you respect a body of people who are passionate, kind, intellectual, and just want to help, then the University of Notre Dame du Lac is the place for you!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The Notre Dame education is everything it's advertised to be; the social life, however leaves more to be desired in terms of diversity and inclusive activities.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The experience I have had here has been terrible. The administration never listens to the students countless people drop out of the sciences because the professors are brutal and no one helps you only works against you. They like to advertise they have the best community but notre dame is not diverse at all so unless you want all your besties to be basic white catholic girls with the same personality this isn’t the place for you.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Going to school at Notre Dame was an experience I couldn't have anticipated. I learned so much inside and outside of the classroom and the community stays with you long after you leave.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Attending Notre Dame was the best decision of my life. Over the past three and a half years, I have received an elite education while forming friendships that will last through my entire life.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: A great college that sets you up for many opportunities during and after school. It feels very welcoming and makes you feel like you’re at home.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University Experience is amazing, it provides ample opportunity for involvement from all types of people, and lets everyone feel welcome. We are e school filled with both great academics and athletes alike, great artists and professors.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Work hard, play hard. Notre Dame is full of energetic and driven students who work really hard but also know how to have some fun
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I love the school so much - football, bars, community, everything - but the social scene can be difficult. Maybe it is because I just had bad luck, but I noticed it is a very cliquey school. There are a lot of MEGA rich people that go to this school that all stay together and also a lot of weirdos. Not ideal!
I still love the school though.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have thoroughly enjoyed many aspects of my Notre Dame experience thus far. The unique communities within the dorms, the gorgeous campus, nationally recognized academics, and successful athletic teams are some of the highlights.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great Community. Focus on academics but plenty of opportunities to branch out. Very work hard, play hard vibe.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I transferred here my sophomore year of college and it is the best decision I have ever made. Notre Dame is a school with both spirit, dedication, and faith unlike any other school. The students care about the people around them just as much as they do their future. Students are smart, but they are not competitive and cutthroat like other comparable universities. And the school spirit is unbeatable, absolutely amazing.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is a great school with lots of opportunities to connect with people different from yourself but it is hard to not doubt yourself and your abilities at a school with so many high achievers.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience so far has been great! The student life is nice and I feel a sense of community within my major. The school could definitely use some improvement in diversifying the student body and staff.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review:
The professors are very willing to help students the best they can, providing lots of resources and office hours. Like any university, some professors are better than others. Many have heavy accents and/or poor teaching styles, so although they still make great effort, it can still be very difficult to learn from them.

There is also a lot of alcohol on campus. Some people have lots of social pressure to drink, depending on who you meet. Other people don't find a problem in this regard.

The campus is also very white, but there are a lot of minority organizations to join. In fact, there is a club for nearly every interest imaginable (250+ options!).
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I mean, it's suppossedly a "good" school, but that doesn't mean that you're going to get a good experience there. Just know your values and there's more to a school than just its ranking.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Notre Dame is an amazing place to spend your undergrad years, with world-class academics, great social opportunities, and the best gameday experience
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Notre Dame offers a truly unique student life experience as well as a well-rounded education and powerful alumni connections. It may be difficult to justify the cost when considering one's return on investment, but I could not imagine going anywhere else and enjoying it half as much.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: A powerful education with a great network of professionals in almost every field. I appreciated particularly the intent on educating the whole person. That being said, in some ways, it has a history of being an "old boys club," which also means white.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Really great number of opportunities and great people. Lifelong friends easily made and bonded. I really enjoyed the sports atmosphere and the dorm life the first couple of years.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Nothing compares to the ND community. Student life tends to center around the numerous activities and events on campus, but Chicago isn't far away either. With a significant emphasis placed on academics, the "work hard, play hard" best characterizes the student body.
The dorm system is neat in that students are assigned to a random single-sex dorm their Freshman Year, and though students can opt to switch, they tend to remain there three, if not four, years. These dorms parallel Greek Life in many ways while being far more inclusive. Students can choose to be very involved in Dorm Life with sports teams, dances, fundraisers, and other community events.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stunning campus, great people. There's truly no place like Notre Dame. The four years here really taught me how to be a force for good in this world.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Strong school spirit, helpful faculty, and ample opportunities to explore and discover your passions. Alumni connections afforded me insights into companies and post-college life. Classes gave me exceptional problem-solving skills and included real-life applications that put me ahead of my peers.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: The campus is beautiful and the academics are excellent. People on campus are very friendly and there is a sense of family among students, faculty, and staff.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Notre Dame is a very special place. From the dorm communities to the friendships built in classes, one can easily make new lifelong friends. I’m excited for the rest of my years at Notre Dame!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Best college experience I could ask for. The people, professors and academics are unmatched. Better in all regards other similar colleges in the top 20.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Notre Dame is a great school, but it's simply NOT an art school. If you are a student looking to major in design, I would advise looking elsewhere. 

I was an ND graphic design student and ended up transferring because I was not being challenged in my art/design classes, and I was missing a creative community. My classmates had little passion for design which affected my motivation and the quality of instruction. The career development resources for design students are limited, and you cannot take a business/marketing unless you are enrolled in the Mendoza College of Business. This is not conducive to the art/design student who must be able to market their services and work. That being said, the instructors and staff are extremely friendly and supportive. However, the price of a Notre Dame education for an art/design student is not worth it.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The atmosphere is wonderful, and the environment and people are phenomenal. The residential dorm system really is hard to beat.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Notre Dame is an amazing school. From it's stunning campus, to it's one of a kind dorm culture and life lasting traditions, there is no other school quite like it. It is truly one of a kind in the best way possible.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: The academics at Notre Dame are excellent - rivaling all top selective schools in the country. The best part is the community. You won't find the same spirited, kind, and dedicated community anywhere else.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The school is extremely challenging and rigorous; however, it really teaches one that you must work hard in order to deserve something great. The academics are wonderful and most professors are truly masters in their fields. The diversity is lacking, however.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a recent alum, I look back on my 4 years at ND as the best of my life. There are so many amazing things about this university— the professors who care about their students as learners and humans, the dorms that offer a supportive community that becomes home, the campus that feels too beautiful to be real. The academics were rigorous; the extracurriculars brought so much joy and lifelong friendships. I grew spiritually through campus ministry & socially through engagement with the Center for Social Concerns. The biggest thing I wish were different about ND is the diversity— they boast about inclusivity but have a long way to go to live up to that. Predominantly white and heteronormative. I encountered people (in the theatre realm, mostly) who are very different from myself & I’m so grateful for them— I wish that level of diversity (of race, sexuality, religions, political viewpoints, etc) were representative of the whole campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the university, however, it seems like it's not progressing forward noticeably in any particular field or issue. To be honest, I'm a bit worried it'll be left behind. Regardless, I still love Notre Dame. The students are all very kind, professors are more often than not brilliant, and the dorm life makes you feel at home. The career services are fantastic. Study abroad isn't as easy to get into as it appears, and the options are limited. It's becoming more of a bar school, party-wise. Overall, there are some faults, but I've learned a lot here. I've progressed greatly in my faith, friendships, and future career.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The community is unlike any other prestigious institution. You do not find cutthroat competition here like you would find at other top 20 universities. Everyone here wants to see each other succeed.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Love the community aspect of this school! The administration is very inclusive and hosts a wide range of types of events--even those outside of the Catholic religion. The academics are very challenging but provide for skills such as critical thinking, time management, and being able to collaborate with others.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I'm a current Sophomore at Notre Dame and I'm loving every minute of it. What sets Notre Dame apart from peer institutions is an incredibly strong campus community you feel the minute you step on campus. And it's a community that's rooted in my everyday life as an undergrad, one that completely enhances my academic and personal college experience. Beyond that, I truly do not think any other school represents the complete "college package" quite like ND: outside of great community, we have top-notch academics, stellar athletics, world class arts programs, a beautiful campus, one of the best alumni networks in the country, incredible study abroad and research programs, an internationally recognizable brand, strong faith-based opportunities, and above all, people who genuinely care about you and want to see you succeed. I really can't say enough about ND and the impact it's had on me already, and I can't wait for the rest of my undergraduate career at the best school in the country.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: You need to be white, rich, and Catholic to fit in. And if you don't like summer camps, tough luck. Have fun being an outcast. There is virtually no diversity, the weather is horrible, and the administration doesn't care what the students have to say. Class sizes are very large, and professors are generally mediocre. I find that I teach myself all the material. My high school did a better job teaching than ND does. The only thing I find redeemable about this school is the study abroad program I went on, which was fantastic. I probably liked it so much because I was finally interacting with diverse people who weren't so fake and cookie cutter.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The thing that stood out to me about the University of Notre Dame was my professors! They have all been willing to go the extra mile in order to teach, be it holding long office hours and staying later or staying back long after class has ended, especially before exams. Their passion not only for the subject but for our education really helped me through some tough courses. Furthermore, the community is excellent.  Notre Dame is truly a family, and dorm communities are very distinct and strong. Each dorm has its own mascots and colors and become a part of a person's identity. It is similar to Greek life but without the negatives of rushing and hazing. Everybody is very kind and inclusive.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Notre Dame is amazing. I am a freshman here and I absolutely love it. The people here are absolutely stellar. Other students are always willing to help you out. People here are friendly and are open to having new experiences. I always feel safe here and feel like it is a home away from home. The professors are phenomenal and are always willing to help. The dorming situation allows me to get to know that people I reside in and form meaningful relationships with them. The campus food is great especially on game day. They have phenomenal resources to get involved in service such as the Center for Social Concerns. Notre Dame is the place to be!!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great School with beautiful history also very beautiful buildings Great athletic program and academics
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: This school was an amazing opportunity to learn from some of the best professors in the world while sitting next to some of the smartest individuals you will ever meet.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's not the most diverse place but the academics is good, people are overall kind, and alums are helpful! professors go out of their way to help you!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: It was a great experience and is a great opportunity for sports and becoming the best of yourself. Don't panic the food is AMAZING. I played Notre Dame Football there and is now drafted in the NFL. The Professors are great they are really cool. There really funny and I liked to invite them to lunch to get to know them in Freshman year. There is nothing to worry about as long as you work hard, do your homework, don't do inappropriate things, and make friends you will be ok and Notre Dame gets you ready for after college. Just feel confident. If you go to Notre Dame you will have the best experience ever. So thats why I think you should go to Notre Dame.😀
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: I really got a different vibe when I visited. However, after attending for 2 months, I have found that this school is cliquey and discriminatory. It is very difficult for non-Catholic students to find a place here. Additionally, the female student body is very fake and it makes it so difficult to make friends. Another thing I don’t like is how isolated the campus is. You have to Uber 5 miles ($10 one way btw) just to get shampoo from the nearest Target. I have found I actually like hanging out in (as students call it) “ghetto” South Bend rather than pretentious Notre Dame. The drinking culture is horrendous, it’s literally the only thing students here know how to do for fun. Everyone is so cookie cutter. HIGHLY considering transferring next year.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: An amazing community, excellent academics, and incredible athletics all combined. With a community centered around tradition and Catholic values, this unique university is home to driven and intelligent students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I could not have asked to go to a better institution and I love the atmosphere and community here. You will not find any other school with a family like Notre Dame.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Notre Dame is a family before anything. For what it (frankly) lacks in diversity, it easily makes up with its strong sense of community and overall just nice guys and gals. From the most antisocial introvert (me) to the most put-yourself-out-there frat guy, Notre Dame has a home for you. Notre Dame boasts a beautiful campus that is not rivaled by many. The resources here allow students to flourish both in mind and heart. The focus on building human beings rather than just smarty pants is what distinguishes Notre Dame from the rest of the top tier pack colleges. Notre Dame professors and classes provide so much to each student due to the smaller (and therefore much better) faculty to student ratio. There is just so much opportunity waiting at each corner here at Notre Dame. While the first week (or even first year) may be a rush and leave you both mentally and socially spent, it'll easily bear its fruit as you come to see Notre Dame as the second home it is.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Notre Dame gave me amazing opportunities to serve those who are less fortunate than I. In addition, it cultivated an environment that allowed me to grow as a student but also as a citizen of the community. I will forever be grateful for all the fond memories, experiences, and lessons I have learned from Notre Dame.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Notre Dame has the academic rigor and challenging discourse of a top U.S. university. What surprised me instead is the kindness and understanding among the students and faculty I encountered during my first year; I wouldn't have expected such a competitive environment to foster such charity in its community.

There is much more to Notre Dame than academics and the promise of an impressive degree; the hefty cost also helps fund significant student amenities and a gorgeous campus. The varsity sports provide entertainment year-round.

Go to Notre Dame if you're looking for more than just a high salary to show for your postsecondary studies–and if you don't mind a spring semester that feels more like winter. (Seriously, it's cold in northern Indiana.)
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience at Notre Dame thus far has been incredible. As Lou Holtz put it, "those who know Notre Dame, no explanation's necessary. Those who don't, no explanation will suffice." What Lou means by this is that Notre Dame truly is unique. From a social scene without greek life to a special dorm culture and Catholic virtues, Notre Dame truly stands out amongst other competitive universities. Additionally, Notre Dame's alumni network is insane, as alumni are always willing to help current students or other alumni. In closing, visit Notre Dame on a football weekend in the fall, and you will be sold.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great professors/classes, lots of resources available to students on campus for career discernment/internships, great athletics, overall awesome student environment and experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I enjoyed my time best time of my life. Enjoyed this year. Made me learn more about myself as well as my peers.  Took the liberties of becoming a adult and I loved every minute of it.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Lou Holtz said, “Those who know Notre Dame, no explanation is necessary. Those who don’t, no explanation will suffice.” Great school, great culture, great campus, great community. Very Catholic, but welcomes all faiths. Can’t beat football season.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: One of the best schools in the nation if you value education, community and faith. Area is somewhat boring, but the people are absolutely incredible.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Notre Dame is a great place to find the balance between academic and social life. While plenty of the students intently focus on studies throughout the week, there also are always football or other sporting events going on throughout the weekends, and there are always Friday and Saturday night parties. However, as with many universities, the teaching staff is sometimes hit or miss just depending on who runs the class, but there are definitely some cool teachers. One of the major things that the University definitely lacks though is diversity, and of literally every sort. Whether it be race, political views, socioeconomic status, or religion, Notre Dame does a really poor job of developing a more diverse student body. 
In all though, the University does maintain a great academic record and provides pretty good financial help, while also offering an engaging athletic program that helps enrich the school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great school for those interested in challenging academics, great campus life, outstanding athletics, and rich tradition.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I had a great experience overall; I would like to see it be easier for students to study abroad but other than that I did not have many complains about my time at Notre Dame.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I will be attending this university in the fall of 2019.  On my visit to Notre Dame, I loved the atmosphere that the student provided and loved the way they cared for each other. Although the rooms were small, students made very wise choices in order to manage their space. The smell, however, is one thing I would change. Overall, my experience with Notre Dame was amazing and I can’t wait to go back in the fall.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: For one I like the academics; I don’t think I’ve ever been more challenged before. Secondly there are some really amazing people there who make it feel like home,e especially in the dorms. The people you meet in your dorms really become your friends and second family, and I really love that. In addition to form life, there are many diverse communities on campus that allow any and all people to fit in, which was really helpful my first year. But, if I had to change something about my school, I would definitely change the way they go about changing the diversity of the campus. Yes, they want more diversity but emphasizing the diverse groups and their culture isn’t very big, and I think if it was then campus would be improved.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great academics, opportunities, and financial assistance! You can receive grants from various organizations and travel the world!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I’ve made the best friends of my life, and everyone is so driven smart and hardworking that honestly just being a student there has made me a better person. The community is insane, alumni are so supportive, football game weekends are the best, professors really care. You just have to get over being in the middle of IN which is not fun.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love ND so far. Most of the professors that I have had really care about they're students. I've also heard the alumni network is top notch. Some of the people here are entitled, spoiled rich kids, but you are still able to find your crowd.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Notre Dame is a family, not just on campus, but across the country. Alumni are everywhere and want to help the next generation of Notre Dame graduates be successful.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Notre Dame is a beautiful school with a beautiful campus full of intellectuals  who will one day make the world a better place. The academics here are wonderful and the students are motivated and driven people, allowing the learning environment to truly prosper. The dining rooms have such a wide variety of food and the athletics here are top notch D1 athletics. Notre Dame is the best college ever and is an amazing  experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Notre Dame offers a wide variety of opportunities. Study abroad opportunities are numerous and the people are very welcoming. The professor are extremely well educated and devoted to helping their students succeed.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I really love the people at Notre Dame. You are surrounded by a student body consisting of a bunch of like-minded individuals, and professors that are passionate about what they are teaching.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The campus is beautiful and everyone  is friendly. The professors truly care about their students and want to see them succeed and are willing to help out any way they can.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love Notre Dame! It's a beautiful place, inside and out. We've got all sorts of clubs, students and academic interests. Personally, I am very pleased with the Mass and Sacrament availability as well as all the Catholic-related activities. Of course, not everybody is Christian; Notre Dame is a home for all. I've already found some solid friends with whom I enjoy spending these cold (and warm) Indiana days. ND meets 100% of financial need; this assistance extends beyond tuition and has allowed me to get the full Notre Dame Experience. Everyone here is passionate about something, and one passion we all share is a love for Notre Dame, Our Mother. Go Irish!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
good school. good people. most importantly, good football.
good school. good people. most importantly, good football.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Notre Dame is a great school. It has a great mix of people and academics and sports. Notre Dame provides great oppertunities to prepare for the future and has many networking events.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
One word: community. If you are looking for a college experience that feels like you are truly home, then Notre Dame is the place for you. It's religion and location make it unique among top-15 universities, but this school is still a classic Work Hard, Play Hard university. No greek life, but the single-sex dorm culture is arguably better -- it holds many of the pros of Frats/Sororities without the pressures of rushing. School pride and interest in athletics is huge. 

But overall, what makes Notre Dame excellent is the people. Notre Dame doesn't accept simply the smartest of the smart. It accepts well-rounded and collaborative people -- it is why the community is so strong. The people who go here are fantastic, supportive, and will become your best friends.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Notre Dame is more than just a school for academics, it is a lifelong community you join the moment you are accepted. Everyone on campus is very supportive of one another and you are encouraged to explore a variety of majors, passions and interests. The students here are very well-rounded and wonderful friends. The experience and education you receive here at Notre Dame is simply incomparable to any other college.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great university in a wonder setting!  Very impressed with their academics!  The facilities are state of the art, the students are smart, respected, and will be future leaders in the world they pursue.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Notre Dame is truly a place like no other. While the weather is like that of any place in the Midwest (horrifying), the community inside the campus is warm and welcoming, it is a place where upperclassmen befriend freshmen and sophomores without hesitation, where everybody is looking to yield a helping hand, and where Saturdays are for college football.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the feeling of family and how everyone is made to feel welcome no matter where they come from or what their story is.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The university of  Notre Dame is recognised for its strong sense of community , excellent academics and an amazing sports culture. Their  unique dorm system  leads to strong bonds between their students.resulting in a solid  alumni network . As the ND admission letter states ‘Welcome home’ , this university is truly a home !   The university of Notre Dame recognises and celebrates the uniqueness of  its student body. It enforces the importance of  values and ethics in your work space which gives rise  to caring and intelligent students  at the end if their four years !  Moreover  at Notre Dame,the football culture is legendary and their games  are  looked forward to and well attended by all - Students , parents & Alumni with equal enthusiasm  ! ‘ Go Irish’ !!!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Notre Dame is a beautiful campus with challenging yet rewarding academics. Football games are a highlight of the fall! Everyone is so welcoming and always willing to help.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Notre Dame is home. When you step on the campus of Notre Dame, there is a feeling of community that embraces you like no other. The academic rigor promises bright futures for all who choose to work hard and go down that road.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Notre Dame is a place unlike any other. With its competitive academics, its numerous student extracurriculars, and its lively dorm life, there are so many opportunities in which one can make Notre Dame their home.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love being at Notre Dame because of the friendships and connections I have made. Being a minority student, I do not think I would have stayed at the school without any friends just because the academics are very challenging and not being used to the lack of southern hospitality up in the midwest.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Beautiful campus with kind, passionate staff and students. Very welcoming to those they feel belong and doesn't usually exclude those who don't.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the campus environment in terms of the housing system.  At Notre Dame, we only have single sex dorms, and we do not have Greek life.  So, students typically remain in their dorms that they are randomly placed in for all four years.  This dorm becomes a family for every student, and the dorms each have an identity.  For example, my dorm, Howard Hall, is represented by a duck mascot.  We build community through weekly meetings in our "pond", intimate weekly masses in our dorm's chapel, and service events unique to our dorm.  In addition to the incredible dorm life at Notre Dame, I have been blessed to be a part of the Band of The Fighting Irish as a saxophone player.  There is no feeling quite like marching through the tunnel to 80,000 cheering fans on every game day Saturday.  The friendships that I have made through band have been life changing for me.  I am truly so proud to be a part of this group, a group that is greater than myself, and I am so thankful.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The University of Notre Dame has become my family and truly home away from home. I have been challenged academically and have developed life lessons and lasting relationships.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: College experience unable to be found elsewhere. The community is quite literally a family, and there's no other place I'd rather want to be studying than here.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I absolutely love the campus!! I have also met a lot of great people here, and the classes are interesting as well as very intellectually challenging. I have also had a ton of great professors!!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love this university. It has a very catholic atmosphere which is a positive or a negative depending on your mindset. It's a great academic school with good athletics, which is hard to find.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I have loved my four years at Notre Dame. It is academically strong with some of the finest, yet personable professors in their respective fields. The faculty truly wants you to succeed in your studies and in your future career. I also love the dorm life and the sense of community found on campus. It is impossible to truly describe without experiencing it firsthand.

The alumni network at Notre Dame is incredible; nearly everyone who graduates has a job lined up, is entering graduate school, or has other concrete plans laid out for post-graduate years.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I made my best friends, completed a world-class education, watched an occasionally-good football team...what's not to love?  The football culture far exceeds the size of this midwestern school, but I love the connections I find with my fellow alumni--as if there were many more of us.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great community, professors who care about your well being, awesome academics, good sports to follow, lots of clubs to join.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have attended Notre Dame for a semester and both the academics and the Catholic community have exceeded my expectations so far.
