The quality of teaching was great last semester, and the resources available, especially for freshman transitioning to college, have been extremely beneficial. The opportunities for growing in the Catholic faith are part of what drew me to Notre Dame, and is one of the unique aspects of the school that is hard to find at any other university.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I think Notre Dame is such a unique school because of its focus on academics, faith, service, and community. I really value the community within the dorms as 
about four in five undergraduates live on campus. The alumni network is also very extensive and extremely valuable in helping student find jobs they love.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Notre Dame is an amazing place to get a high quality education with great reputation and close-knit community feel with fun and spirited student life. It’s not necessary to be Catholic and people who aren’t religious at all won’t feel excluded, but it is especially amazing for people who are religious. I myself am not very religious but was raised in the faith and do appreciate it, so I enjoyed being around it and taking the required Theology and Philosophy courses. Everyone is extremely nice and collaborative! Very smart people here and caring professors. Single sex dorms is a negative as well as less opportunities for medical professions, as there is no hospital or medical focus here. I would say it’s best for business, engineering, or liberal arts. Although science is still good here and people get into great grad programs no matter what they want to continue on studying!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am currently a student at Notre Dame, and I love everything about this school. The classes have a rather heave workload, but the professors are very good and care about their students. There is an unreal sense of community, and while there isn't any Greek life, the dorm life is incredible.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Excellent campus environment and academics. Faculty pays great amounts of attention to students and are willing to put in the extra effort to help you.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Worth its money! The only hindrance is that it's too expensive.
I only studied here for 2-week summer program. No matter how short the duration is, I really love this place and want to turn back someday (as long as my academic gets better and I'm lucky enough to come back.)
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Great school that has tons of opportunities and also a great place to live.  The culture is not competitive - everyone wants to help you.  The dorm system is very unique (similar to frats and sororities dependent on how much you want to be involved) and in my mind one of the most attractive things about the school.  There are tons of cool traditions through the dorms and university. 
 The atmosphere is definitely work hard-play hard.  Student body is super nice. Professors are great.  Administration and Catholic-ness can get to be a little much at points if you aren't religious but I've still found it to be a plus.  Overall, I would absolutely recommend this to anyone who wants to have fun in college while getting a great education.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: No other university can compare to the University of Notre Dame. None of the normal grades refer to the level of care and kindness on a campus, but they make all the difference at this university.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have always wanted to go to Notre Dame. Here I become the best version of myself: academically, spiritually, socially, and all the rest.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am a city person. Notre Dame is not located in the city or near a city, matter of fact. That shows you how amazing this school is ... I left my great city of Boston to come out to the middle-of-nowhere Midwest to come to Notre Dame
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have had the time of my life at this university! Everything about it is wonderful and anyone with an open mind would love it as well!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Notre Dame is a great choice for anyone choosing where to go to college. Like all schools, there are some flaws (the tuition), but overall the school is well-run, the student body is filled with great people, and the alumni are all willing to help you get internships and jobs. I have had many excellent professors so far, and most classes are not too big. There is so much to do on campus, from watching tons of competitive division 1 teams, spending time in our tight-knit dorms, and eating at our 2 great dining halls, LaFortune Student Center, & Reckers. The library is newly renovated and has tons of space; there is an Au Bon Pain inside to boot. There are some drawbacks: the weather is not the greatest, but we have not had much snow in the last 2 years. The city of South Bend isn't the best (it is improving), but there are sufficient amenities within a 15 minute drive. The school spirit is tremendous here, and so many students really feel like this place is home.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Notre Dame offers a diverse campus which challenges you academically while pushing you to grow as a person, too. It emphasizes the importance of community and service which should drive each person's daily actions. Additionally, the order of the Holy Cross preaches the Five Pillars which should serve as the foundation of one's life: Mind, Heart, Zeal, Family, and Hope.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the Notre Dame! The community experience is unparalleled and finding another Domer outside of campus is always a special experience. Not only are my professors well-qualified and really care about their students, but the other students care about me too. Especially in the college of engineering, we work together to get things done, just like I have in my internship. Campus is beautiful and safe, and I get to live across the hall with all of my best friends.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Notre Dame is a very unique university. The campus is beautiful and there are so many fantastic opportunities for its students, but it takes a certain type to go here. ND does lack diversity; it isn't non-existent, but it is not the school's strongest aspect. While this may seem stifling to some more adventurous types, I've found many genuinely good friends there, of multiple races and genders. You have to remember that this is a Catholic university, so there are certain limitations to that. The dorms aren't co-ed and there isn't Greek life. The dorms almost become sororities and fraternities, which you can choose to involve yourself in to the degree that you want. The guys dorms are a lot more lax on the rules than girls dorms, which is unfair, but we make it work. There are almost always dorm parties or off-campus house parties on the weekends. While ND is a very academic/nerdy school, we still know how to be social. And of course, football is integral to ND life!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Notre Dame is a great college. Great atmosphere, with lots of sports to cheer on that are usually competitive and great academics for a good balance. Lacks diversity and cultural experiences but that is expected from a private Catholic school. Huge emphasis on academics and religion. Students are very motivated and determined to get good grades.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Notre Dame is a wonderful environment to grow academically, spiritually, and in every other aspect of life. Tradition and student life make it the most memorable years of a person's life.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great school. Football season is a lot of fun and the teachers are great. Except for a couple large freshman classes, the class size is very small.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Amazing place, very expensive but worth it if you put the work in, nothing else like it. The classes are very challenging, mostly because of the pace and being surrounded by so many other smart peers. Professors are very knowledgable in their fields. A lot of international TA's but courses are taught by mostly US professors.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved my experience at Notre Dame. The closeness of the student community is truly something else. I loved that the campus was small enough that you can get to pretty much everything pretty easily. The campus is beautiful. There were so many opportunities to get involved, whether it be through student groups, research, work, volunteering. Many of the students had similar values as me and it was very easy to make friends. The dorms really facilitated this as well. I did not like that there were double standards as far as enforcing rules in women's vs. men's dorms.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Student%20Life.Review: Football season is a great time to come together to cheer on the school and great way to make new friends.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Notre Dame's football team is undoubtedly the focal point of student life - especially in season. Football games every weekend are truly a spectacle to behold, with almost all of the students attending the games. Fan support is unparalleled.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I think our diversity is pretty good. However, you must also understand that there are a lot of Notre Dame students who are athletic, conservative, white, upper-middle class, and Catholic. That being said, there are SOO many other ways to judge diversity than checking boxes like that.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Our school spirit and support for our athletic teams is absolutely incredible. I love going to games and they're so fun because so many people go. Most of our students were athletes in high school so if they aren't playing a varsity sport they are probably still active on campus. Interhall sports (between dorms) are big, super fun and can get pretty competitive. There are also typical intramurals and co rec sports.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Everyone goes out to watch the football games. We are known for our touchdown Jesus.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Notre Dame doesn't have a Greek Life, rather students are randomly assigned to one of the 28 dorms on campus. People generally grow pretty attached to their dorm and the people they live with. There is a huge sense of pride and family within each dorm and from my experience this dorm lifestyle sort of provided a surrogate Greek Life without having to apply or rush. Personally, this Greek Life-esque community in the absence of an Greek system was one of the things that attracted me to Notre Dame. It's got the connections and family feel without having to be accepted. You are already "accepted" and don't have to prove anything to anyone.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Football, basketball, and hockey are probably the biggest sports, with football being the major one by far. Football game days are awesome! Campus is buzzing with excitement all day and that continues into the stadium during the game. The student section is a ton of fun and almost all undergrads attend the games.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: There is not Greek life, but dorm life is quite similar.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: School spirit is very strong.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Uhh.... Notre Dame FOOTBALL. It's everything.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review:
The atmosphere on football weekends is electric. So many alumni come back to support us. 

The basketball games are my favorite, everyone gets really into it. 

The athletes are given some perks, but we see them all around campus all the time so they're definitely still "one of us."
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Everyone enjoys going to all of the sporting events. The outside community is also very involved.
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: I like going to the football games
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Our school revolves around football in the fall.  It's truly a wonderful tradition.  Basketball is another big sport for us.  Other than that, most people don't pay much attention to a sport unless they play it, their roommate plays it, or they know someone on the team.  Especially being a science major, I almost never interact with any athletes.  Most of them are in the college of business or the college of arts and letters.  Therefore, the athletics are a big deal for me, but I don't have a personal attachment or connection to any of them really.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Everyone is white, rich, preppy, and stuck up. Not much diversity. Seems like a lot of the diversity comes from athletic teams.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Notre Dame is a great school if you love football or basketball. Our teams are good, so it's easy to be a fan. Fun games
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review:
At Notre Dame the big guy on campus is football, and it's wonderful. The tradition that is Notre Dame Football is a part of my experience here at Notre Dame that I wouldn't trade for the world.

The other athletics are good and important as well, but do kinda get overshadowed by football.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review:
School spirit is high at Notre Dame. This is most evident in regard to football, but it applies to other sports as well and the student body in general. Even if you don't like sports, you can participate in the social aspect of football gamedays. Most students buy season ticket packages and go to all of the home football games, but there are some who don't. Generally, people love football season, but it does take away an entire day of the weekend that could have been used to study or do homework, so it can be difficult to balance football and studies. 

Intramurals are also very popular. The student body here is very athletic, and many students play on intramural teams for their dorms or co-rec teams with their friends. A wide variety of sports are offered, and some I had never even heard of before coming to Notre Dame, such as broomball. We even have sports like curling, bowling, and racquetball, in addition to more popular sports like football, basketball, soccer, volleyball, and lacrosse.

One thing Notre Dame could improve (and is currently in the process of improving) is the gym/workout facilities for general students. For being such an athletically inclined student body, the resources are sometimes inadequate to meet the demand. For example, it can often be difficult to get a treadmill, especially during the spring, when people are training for the Holy Half Marathon. The Campus Crossroads project is aimed at making the football stadium into a student center with classrooms and athletic facilities, so hopefully this problem will be solved soon.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Notre Dame athletics are top-notch and a lot of resources are used to make sure the athletes here succeed. Athletics is a big part of this school, especially football.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Most students are extremely involved in sports in some way, and while Notre Dame football rules the fall semester, other sports such as basketball and hockey are well attended, and most sports are extremely competitive nationally. School spirit is extremely high. Facilities are phenomenal and are continuing to be improved.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Athletics dominate social commentary at Notre Dame. It's that simple.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Football Saturday's in the fall are the best, but I also enjoy going to basketball, soccer, volleyball, and hockey games.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Our football team usually does well during the season.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The atmosphere during football season is amazing, but some of the equipment in the Roc is old and outdated. It's an old building, and you can tell because it feels like they just tried to make this building into a gym, it doesn't feel like that's what it's purpose was because the layout, especially the weight room, could have been done better.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Notre Dame football all the way! Although I am more of a baseball fan living in a football crazed world.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I am very athletic and competitive and all of my needs are met
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There are so many active people on campus and great facilities (not to mention the two lakes and beautiful surroundings for running)--it's great!
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: With a football team that consistently ranks in the top 10 and two basketball teams with numerous national championships, as well as competitive teams for every varsity sport on campus, Notre Dame has a top-notch athletics team.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The administration is pretty strict. You cannot be in a dorm of the opposite sex past a certain hour every day of the week.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: They do a great job of balancing rules with context. For example, alcohol is prohibited on campus and in the dorms (undergraduate) but they are not purposely looking out to bust kids. The same goes with most rules--they are willing to listen to the context and not be black and white.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The strictness at my school depends on who and where you are. The boys dorms get an extreme amount of leniency while the girls dorms are under extremely strict rule (which are supposed to be applied to all dorms). I'd like the school to re-think co-ed dorms, but do to the religious affiliation that is very unlikely. Also, a very annoying policy is parietals--where guys have to be out of girls dorms and vice versa by 1:00am on weekdays and 2:00am on weekends.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There's definitely a double standard in rules. For example, boys' dorms are more lenient with drinking and breaking parietals. Parties absolutely would get busted in a girls' dorm but blatant underage drinking is for the most part disregarded in male dorms. As long as you're not openly drinking though, a girl dorm RA probably won't bust you. There are consequences if you are caught violating rules too obviously. There are strict policies regarding drugs and cheating, which can get you kicked out if they are serious enough. Attendance depends on the professor. Some will deduct class points for absences; others will never take attendance at all.
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: I just get the sense that everything here is like a show for prospective students and tourists.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Have personally not had any problems
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The Administration has made a lot of headway in the past few years in solving many of the campus problems previously had.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: It's an elite Catholic university, so mostly white, straight kids.  More latinos than you'd expect.  Lots of geographical diversity.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Guys are super nice, fun, and very attractive. No complaints here.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Notre Dame football is incredibly fun, whether the team is winning or losing.  Football season is so good that people schedule their study abroad options around it and the alumni basically throw the students a party during tailgating time.  Basketball and hockey are also fun, but nothing close to what football is.  Intramurals and dorm sports are super fun and many people get involved.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: They're strict on some things, but they're lenient about what matters.  They're lenient about drinking, parties, and visitation, but don't push the rules they do have.  Also parietals exist, but they're not super hard to break and they don't ruin the experience at all.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Noise/social gatherings are fine during normal hours of the day, but at night (once quiet hours have begun) excessive noise is not tolerated and members of the opposite sex are not allowed in the dorm (except in designated 24 hour spaces). This is strictly enforced. Regarding alcohol, everyone knows people are drinking, and it's accepted. None of the hall staff is out to get underage drinkers or anything like that. However, there is a STRICT no drug policy.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The ND Varsity Athletics program is top-notch. If you want to play a sport in college and you're good at it, this is a great place for that. Athletes get to live with everyone else in the dorms, and they get special (usually better) dining hall food, free Under Armor backpacks, and a personal nutritionist. There is a lot of time commitment to the sport, but most would say it's worth it for the love of the sport. As far as student involvement, students mostly support the football, basketball, and hockey teams. And our school spirit...is that even a question? Go Irish!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: We are pretty strict here, being a Catholic conservative traditional university, but it's mostly for our own good, and I don't think they're really "out to get us" unless we're being blatantly bad.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Parietals run the campus during the week. On-campus parties never go past 2 am on the weekends, and they are virtually non-existent during the week. Also, drugs are not tolerated at all. But besides that, it's pretty much anything goes.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The school spirit here rivals anywhere else in the country, and almost every student was a varsity athlete in high school. We all understand sports and love sports.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The girls here are extremely attractive and very smart, both of which I admire in a woman.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Boy dorms throw great parties, but girl dorms can't have any. Parietals are strictly enforced. Alcohol is very easy to get and drink, but don't even think about drugs. You will be kicked off campus
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Everyone comes together for all of the sports on campus whether it be soccer, basketball, hockey, and football of course. Athletics are definitely a huge part of campus, especially football. If we lose a game, it is extremely obvious that night.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I am a girl. 75% of the guys here are very attractive. If you are not into the athletic Irish boy, then your selection may be a little more slim. The girls here are mostly average. There are a few ugly ones and a few beautiful ones that you will learn to envy.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The RA's and such don't try to get anyone in trouble, they just deal with a situation if it arises.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: In my opinion it is a bit too strict in areas such as visitation in dorms, but simultaneously I understand that they have their purpose. Not to mention that being that this university is Catholic it is to be expected that their rules and regulations line up with that of the Vatican's.
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: The school spirit of ND is fueled very much so by our athletics department. Every year we achieve the honor of being the national champions in some sport or another and that is extremely vital to continually fueling the fire. We are all invested in sports in one way or another.
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: Athletes are almost considered celebrities on campus.  The university revolves around the athletic program
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Helpful and they care a bunch about the school/students.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: ND is a very sporty place and makes it easy to watch and play several different types of sports.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Both sexes are generally pretty fit (as ND is a very fit campus), and consequently have relatively attractive bodies. Most people dress comfortably, and there generally isn't any pressure to dress out of your way unless its for particular events (whether it be for parties or interviews). There is generally a wide array of interests among both sexes. A lot of people give ND girls flak, and as such, I was worried there wouldn't be many attractive girls. When I got to campus, I definitely realized that my worry wasn't necessary, as there are a bunch of fit, happy, intelligent girls everywhere on campus. I wouldn't say that 100 percent of them are supermodels, but is that really true anywhere? They are a great bunch.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There is no Greek life at Notre Dame, making it very difficult to get into a frat or sorority.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: They are only strict about things they should be strict about, and are very lenient about things that one expects they will be able to do going into college.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Very forward thinking for the administration to allow alcohol under 14% in the dorms. While they claim they don't want underage kids drinking, the RAs enforce the rules so the enforcement varies. Most RAs are fine with underage kids drinking as long as it is safe. Give freshman a reason to stay on campus rather than going off and getting in trouble with the law. As for other aspects of the administration, because it is a Catholic school, it is slow to change and stubborn on some issues.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Obviously football is the main sport, but all varsity sports get attendance and Notre Dame consistently fields good teams in a variety of sports. Intramural are fun and many people play them. Many sports offered from the famed full pad-full contact football for the men, to coed broom ball.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: ND is strict about all drugs. They essentially don't give a hell about drinking which is awesome and right.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Tons of white kids.  There could definitely be more ethnic diversity and religious diversity.  There is a great deal of sexual diversity.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: If you are into marijuana, this place is not for you. The school is very strict when it comes to weed on campus. Bars are pretty easy to get into if you have a decent fake, and there's no need to worry about drinking in the guys dorms.  However, RAs in the girls dorms are some of the most strict, fun-crushing people on campus so don't mess around in the girls halls.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The best time of the year is when the football team is winning. Everyone pretty much follows the team and goes to the games. A lot of students get exercise, but some are gym class heroes or take things a little too seriously at the rec center. Also, athletes are treated like gods at Notre Dame.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The university is still predominantly upper to middle class Catholic whites but this is because the majority of those who apply fall into this category. As many kids went to Catholic high schools as public, creating a conservative mood on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Very lenient with beer (including underage drinking, but not so much with drugs or hard alcohol. Very strict honor code as evidenced by all the football players getting kicked off the football team for violations.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Notre Dame Football dominates fall weekends and tailgating becomes a ritual. Huge intramural sports program as over three quarters of the student body played varsity sports in high school.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There is no greek life.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Parietals and drug use policy are extremely strict.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Football is obviously a huge part of student life here but not many other sports are recognized as a result.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Being a Catholic university, many characteristics seem to be almost homogenous and the student body is not very diverse overall.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I'll begin by saying that the people I have met are some of the smartest and hardworking people I have met. However since one becomes really comfortable within our college community student looks seem to decline as winter arrives. You will begin seeing lots of students attend classes in their sweats and tshirt and sweater. I personally don't feel comfortable dressing like that, but to each his own. As far as interests and relationships, I have found that within my groups of friends they all have different interests weather it be in athletics, arts, academics, politics, etc. The things that have started and held the circles I am in were dorm life and my major, for some time during freshman year it was when I was in rowing club.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review:
When it comes to academics Notre Dame is very strict. Upon admittance your are introduced to the honor code and your are expected to follow it. We are expected to be in an environment where professors should be able to leave the room during an exam without any cheating occurring. If any does take place students are responsible for reporting it, we are held accountable for making sure that we all have the same chances, opportunities and fairness. 

When it comes to social life Notre Dame does give us some freedom. First of all there is no greek life but that usually leads to a sense of brotherhood within all the dorms, one in which you don't have to be tested or hazed to get in to. There is no co-ed housing and we do have parietals. During the weekends we are allowed to have parties in the dorms as long as the host takes full responsibility for making sure guests don't get out of control and aren't put in danger. Alcohol is allowed, well beer is allowed for those who are of legal age. Liquor is not allowed at all, if someone is caught with liquor they will be fined. 

As I said Notre Dame does gives us some freedom, however I think as college students we feel the need to party and get crazy sometimes. Therefore, I believe that in order to keep the academic standing and the values we have as people, they are right in restricting our social lives a bit.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Immense amount of school spirit. GO IRISH!!!
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: People in both college and dorm are accepting.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: The strictness in regards to underage drinking is completely lopsided. Male students are rarely punished for infractions, while female students are humiliated and punished severely. Visitation requires students to leave opposite-sex dorms are certain times, which fosters skewed gender relations.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The football team is a hugs part of Notre Dame student life, which can be overbearing but is mostly fun. Other sports are important as well, including hockey and basketball. Women's basketball is extremely successful. Club and intramural sports are well-organized and very fun. Athletic facilities are pretty good. Rolfs, the student workout facility, has most of the equipment needed, but the Rock is not as well-equipped. Both could be bigger and with more available equipment.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Diversity is present on campus, but it is not overwhelming by any means. Racial diversity is pretty lacking, and because Notre Dame is a Catholic university, most students come from the same religious background. There is no anti-LGBT sentiment, but out LGBT students are rare.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The facilities for the athletes are amazing, and the gym is available and close to many dorms on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Being a catholic institution, Notre Dame cares about certain things more than others, such as the opposite sex staying in your dorm room more than underage drinking.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: It's the straight, white, Catholic, Republican DisneyLand. With that said, diversity is keenly stressed throughout the school and, to be honest, no one cares if you're anything different since in the end, you're all Domers
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Guys are really in shape, good looking Irish/ Other White Catholics for the most part. Girls are a disparity between real nice and moderately stuck up, from good girls to smokeshow. There's a real diversity in the girls as much as overall success in the guys
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Parietals. The dreaded word at ND. You can have your booze, you can try to hide your drugs, but if your girlfriend comes aver past 2 on a weekend or 12 on a weekday, you're in trouble. With that said, it is a perfect excuse to clear your room so you can sleep
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: If there's a sport, there is a 99.5% chance that we not only have facilities for it, but also an intramural league to play it
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: You get what you paid for.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Girls could be better... but what do you expect at an academic institution? This isn't some state school...
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Everyone is friendly and generally good-looking, but more so guys than girls.  Some people think that the single-sex dorms and parietals make things awkward, but I don't see it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Hall staff usually aren't too strict--male dorms throw parties and drinking is widely overlooked.  My biggest complaint is about parietals--it's a prime example of how the administration sometimes treats students like children.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review:
While ND has taken steps to increase ethnic diversity on campus, the school is still very much mostly white, upper/middle class, and Christian (specifically Catholic).  That being said, my roommate of 2 years is African American, and he seems happy here.  There are many cultural productions, such as Asian Allure and Latin Expressions, that help to share different cultures that students might not normally experience.

Campus isn't very political, unless you count the occasional Viewpoint (newspaper opinion section) Wars that occasionally ignite.  80% of students are Catholic, but there is no pressure whatsoever to participate in religious life if you do not want to.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The guys are very good looking. The girls are decent. There are some hot girls and some not so hot girls. The guys are very athletic and overall better looking. Everyone is friendly and intelligent. A lot of people kind of look and act the same, but if you are into the preppy, put together look then you are set. If you are looking for hipsters or activists, ND isn't really the right place for you. People are very main stream. Also, most people are very involved in community service and business clubs.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The administration is pretty strict about alcohol, parietals and drugs. Given that they are pretty strict, people regularly break the parietals rules and the RAs are fine with it, especially in the guys' dorms. The RAs aren't trying to get you in trouble, but if your door is open at 3 AM and you have guys and girls in there, you will most definitely get in trouble. Basically with parietals, don't be stupid about it. Most people drink on campus. The guys dorms are very relaxed about alcohol and often host dorm parties. Girls dorms are way way more strict. It is not an issue if you have alcohol in your room or if you are drinking with a couple people, but don't have a party in a girls dorm.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: A lot of people play sports. We have intramural sports, dorm sports, club sports and varsity sports. Almost everyone is involved in one sport or more. The intramural sports and dorm sports are super relaxed and  low commitment. On the other hand, club sports can get very intense; it depends mostly on the sport. As far as varsity sports, almost all the athletes are recruits. It is pretty hard to walk on to any of the varsity sports, but I do know people that have done it. Good luck if you are trying to walk on! Football is by far the most watched sport. Some professors let students out early on Fridays of football weekend. The campus is packed on football weekends. Everyone is super spirited! Football weekends are my favorite part of ND. Don't worry if you don't know anything about football; you will love it by the time you graduate. Everyone attends the games and the tailgates. It is a ton of fun!
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review:
Most people you meet are Christian. Religiously, I would say that the diversity is poor at Notre Dame. That being said, I am not very religious and I don't feel pressured to go to church or engage in religious events. If you are religious, there is a lot for you to do though. If you are not Christian, you might find the Christian aspect overwhelming, but the students are very respectful of other religions. I am sure you can find a bunch of religious sects within South Bend, so I wouldn't worry too much. 

Racially, Notre Dame was way more diverse than I expected. I thought it was basically going to be all white. I was very wrong about this. There are Asians, Hispanics, African Americans and more. I have a friend from Ecuador and another from South Sudan. People really do come from all over the US and all over the world. 

As far as socioeconomic aspects, I would say most people are middle class or upper class, but there is a fair share of lower class people as well. Since there aren't many things that people spend a lot of money at ND, people don't really notice what each other's financial situation is. Your economic background is not something to really worry about. 

Politically, almost everyone is conservative, but people are pretty democratic on social issues. The university is way more conservative on social matters than the student body. 

To address sexual orientation, I know plenty of gay and lesbian people on campus. People are accepting and the administration makes efforts to build a community for gay/lesbian/transgender students. My roommate was lesbian and she is one of the coolest people I met on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There are tons of intramural sports available to students and the sporting events are fun.  I wish the football tickets were a little cheaper but whatever.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The administration tends to be pretty fair as long as people are being safe. They accept that underage drinking will occur however drug use is not tolerated at all.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I guess most of my friends all have the same opinions, so I have never felt isolated in my beliefs, but I've head that Notre Dame is relatively intolerant.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: It's often super strict, and that can hinder the fun.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: The boys are pretty attractive up here, however often it gets so that people dress pretty grossly.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Notre Dame works very hard to make sure the campus is as diverse as possible.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Notre Dame has been voted the best fan base and the best alumni in the nation.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Most people are Catholic but political views differ.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Gender relations could be better because of parietals and single-sex dorms
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The campus revolves around football in the fall.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The school is very strict about drugs, and not too strict on underage drinking. Parietals are a pain.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Not very diverse but it seems to be working actively to become more diverse and accepting.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Everyone loves all the sports team. A lot of the students not on varisty sports teams played varsity in their high schools so the club level and intramurals are always full. Interhall sports are also very full.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Du lac and parietals are more strict than other schools but it's what is expected at a prestigious Catholic University.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: As a diversity student, I have always felt welcome and have never felt that any of my characteristics that would classify me as a minority student have been used to discriminate against me in any way.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The school is strict about some important things, but pretty lax about alcohol and parietals/quiet hours.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There is a lot of diversity here on campus, not only racially, but individually--we all have come from different backgrounds and have unique stories to tell.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Parietals. And super anti-drug. Caught once, and you're suspended for a semester or yr
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: white.. catholic.. etc.. etc.. what you see is what you get. You can find diverse groups, but you really have to look to meet those ppl, especially religion-wise
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Being a fan of the Irish is quite an experience. Fall revolves around football and it's fun whether you like football or not. Everyone and their mother here is some kind of athlete.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Athletics here are great! There are a wide variety variety of sports including football, hockey, soccer, lacrosse, etc. The athletes perform very well and school spirit and fan support are high. Game day, especially for football, is always crazy and super fun.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Football is HUGE here, sometimes to the detriment of the values of the school. I like the gyms a lot.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Actually, Notre Dame doesn't have any Greek Life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Diversity is sometimes a problem on campus, but I think it has been slowly improving. Clubs like PRISM and the 4 to 5 movement have made the campus generally accepting of LGBTQ individuals. Racial and ethnic diversity is perhaps more of a struggle for some.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There is a great diversity on this campus as there should be everywhere.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: campus has to be strict regarding drug and alcohol use, as well as students being honest.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Notre Dame has very high standards for its students, academic and otherwise
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Definitely needs some work, but great potential
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I love Notre Dame football!!!
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Notre Dame's varsity athletics teams are typically vying for conference or national championships and, if possible, intramural athletics are just as competitive as the varsity athletics. So many of the students here starred in sports in high school and chose to attend ND because they preferred to pursue academics rather than go to a small Division I program.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Everyone is white, and mostly religious, and there is acceptance of other life styles to a certain extent, but no one gets judged too harshly for discrimination. Google the notre dame anti-gay comic scandal for a very scary example.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Girls and boys have  separate dorms
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Havent had time yet after only one semester to fully evaluate this
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: At Notre Dame, there isn't a Greek life, but there is a dorm system. Everyone seems to love their dorm.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: We have a great football team (and pretty much everyone goes to the games). The facilities for non-athletes are great too, as we have a pool, an indoor track, a huge weight rooms, a ton of courts, and much more.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Notre Dame is very strict when it comes to their rules. We have to follow parietals, which are a set of rules that says the opposite gender must be out of the dorm by midnight during the week and by 2 in weekends. It's great.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There are parietals, which are set times when members of the opposite sex can't be in the single sex dorm rooms.  There are also strict policies on drug use and semi-strict policies on alcohol consumption.  Overall, it isn't too bad.  Parietals can be rough sometimes (especially on the weekends) but otherwise it doesn't really interfere that much.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Notre Dame gets a worse rap than it deserves. I came in expecting a horde of rich white republicans. I have international friends, gay friends, liberal friends, and I don't know of any of them being given a hard time by anyone. I find the diversity here great.
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: If you don't make problems and are reasonable you won't have issues. Pretty fair in all regards.
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: Notre Dame football is an experience like no other
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: Sports are a huge part of the Notre Dame campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Gender relations could definitely be better
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Notre Dame athletics is  HUGE but if you aren't into sports you will not be veiwed as an outcast.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The university as a whole is taking steps to make the campus more diverse and educate students about diversity.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The diversity isn't the best, but I feel completely comfortable and have everything I need
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Notre Dame has a type; if you like it, you're set.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Gender relations are a bit strained at times and it can be a bit difficult to make friends with members of the opposite sex (especially if you are in a major without a lot of guys).  This does not change my resolve that ND is the best university ever!
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: ND football was a great (although heartbreaking at times) experience even during the years before our recent football championship run.  The campus is flooded with fans and alumni starting every Friday of the football weekends and there are a whole series of related traditions.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Notre Dame is a campus filled with athletes, varsity and non-varsity, and the school really caters to that.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The university is strict with what it needs to be strict about, then lenient with what it should be lenient about.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The geographic and political diversity is incredible. The ethnic diversity is good, but not the best. The socioeconomic diversity is amazing as well. Almost everyone is a Catholic though.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The girls are so unique because of how accomplished and ambitious they are, yet at the same time they do want to have some fun.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: A dozen perennial national title competitors & most active recsports in the country. Nothing rivals ND sports.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Girls are smart & independent but also stuck up and full of themselves.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: We do not have Greek life on campus. They are replaced by the dorm system, which is incredible.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Because so many upperclassmen live on campus, the campus is not a dry one. Therefore, there is no penalization for of-age students having alcohol in their rooms. The male dorms are very lenient for residents of any ages having alcohol and underage students only get in trouble for excessive rowdiness or having hard alcohol out and around. There are no protests or demonstrations except prayer services--which the campus police do not restrict. Additionally, drugs are extremely punishable--regardless of the type.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Notre Dame has been notorious for its lack of diversity. Although students are generally accepting of those who are different, the lack of diversity among students makes it so many do not even attend the school. The Catholic identity (80% of students) and its Midwest location make for an attractive school for white, Catholics from middle class families. These students make up most of the population.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Notre Dame is all about sports--and not only varsity. Though we have some of the most famed football games in the country. Even more popular than intramural are the inter-hall sports in which dorms compete against each other for a final all-sports cup at the end of the year. We are also the only school besides the military academies to have tackle football as an inter-hall sport. Everyone really rallies behind our varsity teams and takes part in the inter-hall and intramural.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: My school has several strict policies that are enforced by clubs such as National Honor Society and Beta Club. These policies help to guide students and prevent people from cheating their way through school and receiving honors that they do not deserve.
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: The guys here are among the best to be offered at any university campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: If you aren't white, religious, heterosexual, slim, and wealthy, you're going to be an outsider here. There is not only very little diversity, but there is rampant elitism, classism, homophobia, and racism. It's pretty sad.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Campus police will enforce rules to keep the whole community safe.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Football is obviously king, but basketball and the olympic sports are a lot of fun as well.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Nothing more to say than that the university follows the law.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Notre Dame lacks somewhat in true ethnic diversity, but the institution does constantly try to improve its culture of diversity on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: There is not an enormous amount of racial or religious diversity on campus, but there are people from all over the country and all over the world. While a lot of students are from the Midwest, the whole country is represented
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: There isn't too much diversity in this area, because there is not a lot of racial or socioeconomic diversity at present. But everyone is extremely warm and welcoming, and will always be nice and friendly.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Notre Dame is 80% Catholic, so there is not much religious diversity. There also is no real racial or socioeconomic diversity. That being said, everyone is very tolerant of different people.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Notre Dame holds student to high standards.Underage drinking and drug use is not tolerated and is moderated by  Res Life (Resident Life Authority). Also since there are separate girl and boy dorms there are parietals which limits the time the opposite sex is allow in the dorms.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I have a pretty diverse group of friends, but I have always sought diversity.  Most people here are white, rich, and Catholic so it's also easy to just find that crowd or if you're a minority, you can easily stick with your ethnic group because you are invited to many events sponsored to celebrate diversity.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Notre Dame is not very diverse especially in regards to race. A majority of students also share common political beliefs and religious backgrounds.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Varsity athletics are one the most important features of campus life. Aside from that, club and inter hall sports are very popular for the non-varsity crowd.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Notre Dame is a big athletic school, as most people know, and the students love showing their support for their team. Popular sports such as football and basketball are always packed, and students always come ready to cheer for the whole game. Many students often follow teams to away games to watch, and when a team is doing well the atmosphere on campus reflects it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Athletics is heavily emphasized. Most students workout everyday. The facilities are pretty good with lots of machines/weights to use. There are multiple intramural sports happening every week.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There are many different ethnicities at Notre Dame, but they compromise a very small population; most of students are white Americans. However, the university has a vast array of religions and beliefs followed in its student body. Although many are Catholic, there are also many agnostics, Christians, Muslims, and atheists.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The school dearly loves its athletes, and our sports programs seem to make headlines all the time.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: The university does host a diverse student body, though there is still an obvious Caucasian majority.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: It really depends on what dorm you wind up in.  For the most part though, if you are discreet about whatever it is you are doing and not attracting attention to your room while you are doing it, you will probably be able to get away with it.  The rectors and RA's are not going to go around doing room checks.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review:
If you are male, you're set... Dorm parties occur every weekend, and as long as it's contained and not dangerous, RA's will not do too much. If people are visibly inebriated, puking, or drinking hard alcohol, however, they step in and you'll be sent in front of ResLife, the disciplinary arm of the school's housing. As a female, expect to have to go to a male dorm to drink.
Drugs, on the other hand, have a zero-tolerance policy. Seriously, don't bring them. You will get expelled.
Academic policies are fair, and because any work done by you or your professors is covered under academic freedom, the Catholic identity of the school is not stifling to those who wish to pursue other avenues of research or exploration.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: So much about the athletics experience here is great! Certainly the biggest draw is football, which brings with it not only a great game but a great gameday experience. However, most other varsity sports are competitive at a high level in their sport too, from fencing to rowing to soccer and more. Interhall (our version of intermural sports) is something that everyone can be involved in, and many people continue to play the sports they did in high school here. Athletic and workout facilities are great. Basically the only drawback to the athletics program here is that sometimes protecting the players can take precedence over students (search Lizzy Seeberg)
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The athletics are very well-funded and entertaining
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Notre Dame is working hard to increase the diversity of students on campus. Overall it is doing an excellent job and moving in the right direction, even though it still has some ways to go when it comes to racial diversity.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Notre Dame is not only catholic by history, but by practice. The social mood is stunted by the strictness of "du Lac," the policies regarding student life. I haven't yet had a class where I could skip out on classes and still get by; depends on your major though.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Really most things are excused except for breaking parietals and drugs. You get ResLifed if you get caught for either of these, but the alcohol is pretty lenient unless you get sent to the hospital. I know most dorms have a two strike policy on alcohol before they do anything.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I'm a straight guy so I'll just talk about the girls at Notre Dame. Despite popular belief I think Notre Dame actually has a great distribution in terms of hotness. It's just a bell curve; complete with the horrific, ugly-enough-to feel-sad-for girls as well as the amazing goddesses that are the embodiment of human perfection. But for the most part girls are average!
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: If you are a varsity sports player, you are definitely treated definitely and it comes with a lot of perks.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: The Du Loc rules are pretty strict in concept and will be enforced if necessary, but if you don't make stupid decisions the rules usually don't effect you
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Walking around campus, you'll mostly see white, average-looking people who become difficult to distinguish from each other after awhile. Admissions makes sure to bring students from all around the country, however, not just the Midwest. There have been considerable pushes recently to bring in students of different races through specific programs.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Notre Dame has taken great strides to try to improve diversity on campus, but it is still not a very diverse environment because of the applicant pool Notre Dame receives.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: It's hard to find boys who are just looking for friends.  Everyone is awkward especially in the beginning and boys generally just want a hook-up.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Athletics at ND pretty much revolve around the football team. We've got one of the oldest and proudest programs in the country and we've just come off an impressive undefeated season. Almost all of the students buy student passes and go. Other popular athletics involve men's and women's basketball and hockey. The women's bball team just beat out Baylor in March Madness last year, and Lil Wayne actually came to ND this year to see a game--- there are rumors that he is a big fan of Skylar Diggins, a very pretty star player. Athletics are just big at ND in general, and our teams almost always fair well, but there just usually as much hype about them as there should be since mostly they're overshadowed by the football.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Varsity sports at Notre Dame are huge especially football. The spirit and tradition are dominant in the student atmosphere. Other sports such as basketball, soccer, and hockey are also growing in popularity and ranking. The sports programs are very well funded and students are encouraged to attend games.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Overall, the student body is Caucasian, Conservative and Catholic. We do have a decent number of other ethnicities however, just not as many as you would find at other top 20 schools. It is also easy to become involved with different student body groups. For example we have a very active Hawaiin club that holds weekly meetings and puts on a huge luau at the end of the year. So while our student body is not that "diverse," you can find your niche no matter what ethnicity, religion or sexual orientation you are.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Varsity and intramural sports are huge on campus. You have the option to compete in IM for your dorm, or on co-ed teams. Dorm IM are the most competitive - especially football.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The diversity in Notre Dame is limited, however you can find a range of different people from all over the world and the USA. Most students are white and a vast majority are Catholic.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review:
.  People are very friendly on campus.  Can easily fit in with the crowd.
really into sports and really supports the dchool.  A lot of the students are from out of state.  The price to attend is expensive.  Students are willing to study together.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Athletics at Notre Dame are huge. Everyone attends all the home football games and the support for the other varsity supports is impressive. Most students here were varsity athletes in high school, so it is a very jock-friendly school.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Everyone loves Notre Dame athletics.  Football is HUGE - every student goes to every single home game, and a lot try to get tickets through the lottery to go to a lot of away games as well.  Lots of people support other sports as well, and all in all, everyone loves our irish
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Fantastic atmosphere on all athletic game events, it gets your mind off academics for a while, and everyone is together as the fighting Irish.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The student body is not very diverse. I am Filipino-American and am a member of the Filipino American Student Association and the Asian American Association, and there is a close-knit community among groups like this.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: We have "parietals" which mean that the opposite sex is not allowed in your dorm after 2 am on weekends and midnight on week days, and vice versa.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: On one hand, there is lots of diversity in the student body with people from all 50 states and many countries. However, it feels like there are primarily white Catholics throughout campus. I think Notre Dame does a great job of working to uphold its academic standards while trying to admit a diverse student body.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: ND athletics is definitely one of the central parts of student life. Whether it be football, hockey, basketball or any other sport, the ND students will be there cheering on the Fighting Irish. People here are VERY into ND Football and if you don't like football when you get here, you will after your first home game. Student tickets are free for a lot of sports, but you can also get season tickets to many sports for a reasonable fee (which often includes a Leprechaun Legion t-shirt). ND has a lot of tradition -- this year we celebrate our 125th year of football! It is a guarantee that some of your friends and dorm mates will be student athletes. There are no on-campus residences dedicated to athletes, so they are entirely integrated into the rest of the student body. Most of our teams are pretty competitive and Division I. Intramurals and Interhall sports are also huge. Flag football is popular for girls in the Fall. ND athletics are basically just awesome.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The diversity is average, because of the cost.  However, most students feel welcomed and they get along well.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review:
Incredibly Strict in Girls Dorms; Leniant in Boys Dorms – Dorms are single sex, and boys and girls dorms are as different as you can possibly imagine.  Both have have certain hours known as parietals when the opposite sex are allowed to visit.  In a boys dorm, one can break parietals, if careful, and the RA's will typically chose to simply ignore it.  In a girls dorm, an RA will check the room, and if she catches you, she will report you to the rector.  A girl may be thrown out of her dorm and have to move to another dorm, or even be kicked off campus.  

Campus is not dry at all, and alcohol can be found anywhere you go.  Again, in a girls dorm, it has to be kept pretty quiet.  In a boys dorm, it is completely ok to have beer in your room as long as it doesnt end up in the hallways.  Drinking games and kegs aren't allowed (doesn't mean they can't be found though).  Hard alcohol is not allowed on campus, but in certain boys dorms, you can get away with having it as long as you don't leave handles sitting out. 

Regarding drug use, if you are caught smoking or in the possession of any drugs, you are automatically expelled from the university.  It does not matter if you test positive or not.  They have an absolute no tolerance policy.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review:
If you are looking, there's a good chance you'll find a good looking and a "good quality" guy on campus. Just about everyone was an athlete, and everyone's pretty well educated. 

Freshman: don't fall into their hook-up game, I've seen a lot of my friends get hurt. Well, unless that's your style...
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Dorm Policies – The school has a strict dorm policy which includes same-sex dorms,  "parietals" (a time frame where a member of the opposite sex isn't allowed in your room), and a no-toloerance policy for alcohol. Don't get caught, because the punishments can be severe.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Somewhat Strict – Notre Dame can sometimes act draconian with its drug/alcohol policy, as well as its seriousness in regards to parietals (i.e. no opposite gender in dorm past a certain time). Otherwise, the campus is pretty lax.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Pretty self explanatory... Varsity athletics at ND are huge.  Over 90% of students have season tickets to home football games.  Campus is similar to Disneyland with all the fans and alumni coming to watch.  Parking lots are filled to capacity with tailgaters, eager to give a burger or soda to wandering students.  Training centers are amazing, giving not only training equipment to athletes, but also lounges and even special training dinners.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Good Looking – For the most part, everyone at Notre Dame is equally attractive.  Sure, we have nerds and weirdos, but there are also very attractive, normal guys and gals.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Mostly White, Upper-Class – There is a stark lack of diversity on campus, where every male seems to be 6' 0", white, and of an athletic background, and every female appears  to originate from Degrassi. Hispanics and Asians are the leading minority groups (in that order), though specific groups are over-represented: Chinese, Mexican, etc.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: What You Would Expect – Notre Dame, as everyone knows, is the top Catholic university in the nation. This is obviously going to attract a very narrow range of students and backgrounds, with similar values instilled within them before arriving to the university and, thus, most of the students coming from families that have similar work ethics and so on. But, although the university strives to attract academic and Catholic students, it also reaches out to other backgrounds and achieves this goal, to an extent. I am friends with many international students, those of different sexual orientations and even religious beliefs, despite what people might think of the diversity within that particular demographic. But, although there is diversity, it is not obvious if you do not, for the most part, actively seek out diversity. I am already a minority in a respect at the university, as I am Protestant, so I am aware of the diversity religiously on campus, and the university offers a lot in the way of promoting diversity, whether it be religious, ethnicity, culture, sexual orientation, etc.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Fighting Irish Sports – Notre Dame has one of the most recognizable sports programs in the country, and even when football is having a down year the other sports teams are world class.  Most years there are a number of Big East championship teams.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: World Class – The Fighting Irish are D1 and are frequently in the top tier in the country in both men and women's sports. The students and faculty show great school spirit for all our teams. Besides NCAA sports Interhall and section sports have great participation and are amazing.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: White, Catholic – Notre Dame tries to diversify its student body. But it's applicant base is strongly white and Catholic (~85% of it's student body is Catholic). Pick a couple hundred applicants at random and you'll probably get a large amount of white, catholic students. That's just the way it is, and will be. Diversity is important, but if you accept someone into the university just because of their race and reject someone on the same grounds, that's wrong.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: One of the only schools to have campus wide parietals starting at midnight during the week, and at 2am on weekends (Friday and Saturday night). What does this mean? Boys, leave the girl dorms and girls, leave the boys'.  This is great when you need to study/sleep/need-that-awkward-guy-to-leave, however, it's a bit upsetting where you are in the middle of a raging party and 2am rolls by. Also, dorm parties can be busted by the campus police (NDSP) and reslifes (strikes against you) can be handed out if you're found with alcohol. Don't worry though, dorm parties are overrated.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Controlled but Reasonable – Notre Dame strikes a perfect balance between enforcing regulations and letting students have fun. While there is supposedly zero tolerance for drugs and parietals are strictly enforced, most students (myself included) don't mind. Most of us frown upon drug use anyway and like how parietals quiet down the dorms to allow everyone to sleep. (This is especially important in men's dorms where all of the parties are.) The alcohol policy, however, is quite lenient. The consequences of breaking the rules are fairly minor and are not always enforced. Parties can be held in men's dorms as long as they aren't out of control and no one is in danger of being hurt. In summary, be safe and relatively discreet and you should be fine. One final thing to note is that the RAs are more like friends/mentors than authority figures. While they do what is necessary to keep the students safe, they are considered friends by almost all of the students.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Well It Is a Catholic School – There are plenty of different races, poltiical beliefs, religions, and a suprising amount of diversity in sexual orientation. However, for the most part, the university is made up of rich white kids. There is very little economic diversity. There is, however, an overall attitude of acceptance of differences.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The guys are always considered very attractive, the girls not so much. There are definitely attractive girls here, but this is no Arizona State. The nice thing is whoever you talk to, for the most part, will be smart and nice and pleasant to talk to.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Everyone is basically white and catholic. If you want diversity you can join the multicultural groups but that's really all there is. Notre Dame tries really hard to bring people in from all different backgrounds but not many people that aren't catholic and white choose to come here.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Tradition Is Overrated – Football is the biggest in the nation in terms of tradition.  And that's all anybody cares about.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Never Been in a More White-Dominated Place – The University is trying to increase it's reputation as a whites-only school, but it sure looks like everybody is still white.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: We Have All Types – We have both types! Irish and German Catholics... If you aren't white people assume you're an athlete
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The Best – Although the football team has not been elite in some time, fan support and the varsity athletic facilities are world-class.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: There is virtually no diversity at Notre Dame, and ND uses what little diversity there is to advertise the presence of "diversity". Many students have been brought up on their parents' dime and have never had to fend for themselves.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Res-Life BS – Notre Dame allows some great Dorm parties for the younger crowd, and I enjoy the single-gender dorm set-up. Parietals (No-one of the opposite sex allowed in your room from 12AM-9AM weekdays, 2AM-9AM Weekends) are strictly enforced and I find this rule to be over the top.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Drinking, Ok. Sleepovers, No. Notre Dame is incredibly lenient when it comes to drinking (yes, even underage) on campus. The onus is put on RA's (who are some of your best friends) and rectors (who usually don't care at all) to reign in unacceptable behavior. Therefore, if you're not really stupid about it you shouldn't have any problem drinking or having parties whenever you please. On the other hand, don't plan on having girls stay over every night. Once visitation hours are over, it's fairly easy to keep a girl in your room and not get caught, but you're screwed once you finally do.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Gender specific dorms with parietals, meaning men and women can't be in each other's rooms past midnight on weekdays.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Academics.Review: Professors are absolutely incredible on campus, they are really there to help you learn and grow as a person. The workload can be heavy at times (especially for engineers) but you get through it and there are soo many people who are willing to help you.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Great school. Forces you to study hard, but in the end it is worth it. Great learning environment.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Notre Dame has some of the best professors, but I've had a handful that have been terrible! I am fortunate to hear the advice other students have.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: Notre Dame has some of the toughest academics in the country.
Academics.Author: College Freshman
